speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: SCENE VII. Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Flourish of cornets. Enter PORTIA, with the PRINCE OF MOROCCO, and their trains

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Go draw aside the curtains and discover

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The several caskets to this noble prince.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Now make your choice.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: The first, of gold, who this inscription bears,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: 'Who chooseth me shall gain what many men desire;'

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: The second, silver, which this promise carries,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: 'Who chooseth me shall get as much as he deserves;'

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: This third, dull lead, with warning all as blunt,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: 'Who chooseth me must give and hazard all he hath.'

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: How shall I know if I do choose the right?

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: The one of them contains my picture, prince:

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: If you choose that, then I am yours withal.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Some god direct my judgment! Let me see;

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: I will survey the inscriptions back again.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: What says this leaden casket?

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: 'Who chooseth me must give and hazard all he hath.'

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Must give: for what? for lead? hazard for lead?

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: This casket threatens. Men that hazard all

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Do it in hope of fair advantages:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: A golden mind stoops not to shows of dross;

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: I'll then nor give nor hazard aught for lead.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: What says the silver with her virgin hue?

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: 'Who chooseth me shall get as much as he deserves.'

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: As much as he deserves! Pause there, Morocco,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: And weigh thy value with an even hand:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: If thou be'st rated by thy estimation,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Thou dost deserve enough; and yet enough

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: May not extend so far as to the lady:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: And yet to be afeard of my deserving

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Were but a weak disabling of myself.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: As much as I deserve! Why, that's the lady:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: I do in birth deserve her, and in fortunes,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: In graces and in qualities of breeding;

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: But more than these, in love I do deserve.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: What if I stray'd no further, but chose here?

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Let's see once more this saying graved in gold

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: 'Who chooseth me shall gain what many men desire.'

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Why, that's the lady; all the world desires her;

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: From the four corners of the earth they come,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: To kiss this shrine, this mortal-breathing saint:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: The Hyrcanian deserts and the vasty wilds

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Of wide Arabia are as thoroughfares now

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: For princes to come view fair Portia:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: The watery kingdom, whose ambitious head

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Spits in the face of heaven, is no bar

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: To stop the foreign spirits, but they come,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: As o'er a brook, to see fair Portia.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: One of these three contains her heavenly picture.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Is't like that lead contains her? 'Twere damnation

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: To think so base a thought: it were too gross

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: To rib her cerecloth in the obscure grave.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Or shall I think in silver she's immured,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Being ten times undervalued to tried gold?

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: O sinful thought! Never so rich a gem

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Was set in worse than gold. They have in England

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: A coin that bears the figure of an angel

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Stamped in gold, but that's insculp'd upon;

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: But here an angel in a golden bed

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Lies all within. Deliver me the key:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Here do I choose, and thrive I as I may!

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: There, take it, prince; and if my form lie there,

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Then I am yours.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: He unlocks the golden casket

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: O hell! what have we here?

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: A carrion Death, within whose empty eye

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: There is a written scroll! I'll read the writing.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Reads

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: All that glitters is not gold;

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Often have you heard that told:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Many a man his life hath sold

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: But my outside to behold:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Gilded tombs do worms enfold.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Had you been as wise as bold,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Young in limbs, in judgment old,

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Your answer had not been inscroll'd:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Fare you well; your suit is cold.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Cold, indeed; and labour lost:

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Then, farewell, heat, and welcome, frost!

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Portia, adieu. I have too grieved a heart

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: To take a tedious leave: thus losers part.

speaker: MOROCCO
text_entry: Exit with his train. Flourish of cornets

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: A gentle riddance. Draw the curtains, go.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Let all of his complexion choose me so.

speaker: PORTIA
text_entry: Exeunt
